channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2025070234
item.description:
Report E-2025070234

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-02
  • City: BROOKLYN
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/2/25 @1100ct the driver was performing a walk around inspection and noticed liquid dripping from the back of the trailer. The driver grabbed his spill kit and placed the bucket and absorbents under the dripping liquid and called it in to his manager. They then reached out for our response team. The response team arrived @1244ct and began assessing and found that a 55 gallon drum at the back of the trailer had a pinhole at the bottom of the drum. They then removed the drum and placed into a salvage drum. They then used absorbents to clean up any of the material that was released and placed in the drum for disposal. The team was complete @1515ct.

item.title: Report E-2025060504
item.description:
Report E-2025060504

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:37 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release and tote transfer at terminal XDM. It was reported that approximately 40 gallons of Reax Complete released from one 265-gallon tote due to being strapped down. The release impacted trailer #4855008 and asphalt. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100-gallons UN3082 Reax Complete product released to the wooden trailer floor and to the asphalt due to improper loading. The contractors cleaned the spill using granular absorbents and generated (2) 55-gallon metal drums containing the absorbents and (2) 55-gallon poly drums containing the tote and impacted pallets. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025060454
item.description:
Report E-2025060454

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-29
  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 10:19 ET, XPO-XSC reported a 4 ounce of Inferno PLUS released from one 330-gallon poly tote to the top of the container due to the ventilation lid. New lid was ordered for the tote from the shipper. As soon as that comes in, contractors will go out and replace and do a slosh test.

item.title: Report E-2025060222
item.description:
Report E-2025060222

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: SHELBY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed the cylinder was fully discharged and the original container is no longer pressurized due to a failure at the stem. The contractors cleaned and containerized with granular absorbents and placed the discharged cylinder securely to a pallet for return to the shipper. The product impacted absorbents were containerized in a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
